div3.head: 21. Saturday.
div3.p: Warm & pleasant. Hands hauling wood. I was busying studying. Mrs Gilkeson here. Old Mrs Gardner died this morning. I am asked to preach at the funeral tomorrow at 11 a.m. but I cannot think it my duty to disappoint my Congn at Bethel. I proposed to preach at 2.30 or 3 p.m.

div3.head: 22. Sab.
div3.p: Delightful day-not very wet. Preached at Bethel to a pretty good Congn. Intended to go direct to A. Gardner's but when I reached Col. Wilson's found the funl was over. Rev. Mr Davis of the Lutheran Ch. had preached to a large Congn. We dined at Col. Wilson's & came home.

div3.head: Jany . 23. Mon.
div3.p: Mrs McFarland & Robert & I went to Staunton. Dined at the Virginia Hotel on the invitation of Mr Jordan. Bought several articles. Mrs McFarland bought a shawl for $10.50.

div3.head: 24. Tu.
div3.p: Set out at 8.45 & rode on horseback to R.L. Wallaces to see his wife who has been ill for 2 weeks with Typhoid and Pneumonia-is thought to be a little better today; talked with her a few minutes & offered a very short prayer. After dinner called to see Issabella Doak. She is well. Called to see Nanny Doak who is seriously threatened with Paralasis. She is a little better. Mr Ross there has Pneumonia-is better. Stopped a few minutes at Mr Alexr Brownlee's. Returned home much fatigued.

div3.head: 25. Wed.
div3.p: The day very pleasant & warm. I have been reading & resting. Hands hauling firewood.

div3.head: 26. Th.
div3.p: Cloudy & threatening-a little hail then cloudy. At night rain.
Rode to James Hall's & paid him $30.00 for Rhoda's hire last year & he paid me for 4 lbs of Wool & for the Central Presbyterian $2 for this year.

div3.head: 27. Fr.
div3.p: Reading & studying a little. Cool.

div3.head: Jan. 28. Sat.
div3.p: High wind. Studying. Mr Gilkeson sent up his threshing Machine.

div3.head: 29. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a large & attentive Congn and with some liberty.

div3.head: 30. Mon.
div3.p: Clear & mild. Francis Gilkeson & Washington & 3 horses taking out oats & Wheat & a little cloverseed. John Weaver & John Wright assisting. Finished by 3 O'clock.

Wrote to Dr. M.D. Hoge, giving him an order to draw my money out of the Savings Bank. Invest it in Virginia State Stocks (701.56 and about 33 dolls of interest. Or rather the order was for John N. Gordon to draw it & pay it over to Dr. Hoge.

div3.head: 31. Tu.
div3.p: Mary & Frank went to Greenville. Cleaned up 60 bushels of Oats, my whole crop. The morning hazy. About noon begain to rain, & at night rained heavily. About 9 p.m. began to snow.

div3.head: Feb. 1. Wed.
div3.p: Very Cold. 3 inches of snow. I was reading & working.

div3.head: 2. Th.
div3.p: Still very cold. Finished screening wheat had 31 Bushels.

div3.head: 3. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Mr Pilson spent the afternoon here. At 9 P.M. Ther. at +7.

div3.head: Feb. 4. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

Recd a letter from Rev. M.D. Hoge D.D. enclosing Va. State Script for 6 per ct. stock $300.00 I drew what money I had in the City Saving's Bank & Dr Hoge was so kind as to make the purchase for me which he did at 92 1/2. I owe him now a ballance of $5.72.

div3.head: 5. Sab..
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a good Congn. Mary & Frank returned.

div3.head: 6. Mon.
div3.p: James Hays & wife came to see us. I went to Staunton to mail the Minutes of Synod. Spent the night at Col Wm P. Tates. Very kindly entertained.

div3.head: 7. Tu.
div3.p: Pleasant but hazy. Mailed 364 copies of the minutes of Synod & paid a cent each postage. Paid for Printing 500 copies $45.
Pd. D.A. Kayser $37 collected in Bethel for Foreign Missions, also $1.50 for the Home & Forn Record of D.C. Gilkeson.
Pd. Moseby & Taylors Bill to date $15.00

div3.head: 8. Wed.
div3.p: Misses Molly & Catharine Bumgarner & Miss Wilson here last night. I am reading & writing & resting.

div3.head: 9. Th.
div3.p: I went to Greenville. Pd. my Bill to Lightner & Co. of $24.00. Also paid John Robertson for blacksmith work on my waggon. Dined at Dr Tate's.

div3.head: Feb. 10. Fr.
div3.p: Clear & cold. Engaged in study for the Sabbath.

div3.head: 11. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Wrote to Wm. S. Martien & Co. & enclosed two gold dollars for the Presbyterian for Dr John M. Tate.

div3.head: 12. Sab.
div3.p: Clear & cool. Roads rough. Preached at Bethel to a large & very attentive Congn.

div3.head: 13. Mon.
div3.p: Mild. In the evening threatening. I was working all day-putting new spouts to the cistern & repairing a gate. This day Robert commenced teaching a school at Mint Spring, but he had only two scholars.

div3.head: 14. Tu.
div3.p: Day warm. Working & reading. Before sunset it begain to rain & continued till bedtime.

div3.head: 15. Wed.
div3.p: After midnight it began to & continued moderately till noon only 3 or 4 inches on the ground. Robert & James were at a Party Wm L. Smiths where it was said there were 150 persons. I began today to record the Minutes of Synod. Wrote only 3 pages.

div3.head: 16. Th.
div3.p: Writing Minutes &c.

div3.head: 17. Fr.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: Feb. 18. Sat.
div3.p: It began to snow in the night & about 4 inches fell. In the morning it turned to rain & rained moderately. I was preparing for the Sabbath.

div3.head: 19. Sab.
div3.p: The day very cold & the roads very bad. I preached to a small Congn.

div3.head: 20. Mon.
div3.p: Spent the day reading & writing.

div3.head: 21. Tu.
div3.p: Day very mild. The evening clouds from the South & threatening. James building a hogpen.

div3.head: 22. Wed.
div3.p: It began to rain in the night & continued till 10 a.m. then clear & warm. Writing & working.
Samuel & Lizzie Pilson came here to spend the night.

div3.head: 23. Th.
div3.p: This the day for Concert of Prayer for the youth of our Country. We went to Bethel. The meeting was not large but somewhat interesting.

div3.head: 24. Fr.
div3.p: Working & studying.

div3.head: 25. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Robert & Mary went to Greenville & Mr. Wallace's.

div3.head: 26. Sab.
div3.p: The day clear & cool. Preached to a large & attentive Congregation & with some liberty.

div3.head: 27. Mon.
div3.p: Spent the day reading.

div3.head: Feb. 28. Tu.
div3.p: Day very pleasant. I got Judge Shod at Lightners. Dined at John Hays' & wrote an Article of agreement between John Hays and James M. Hays. Called at Saml. Hays'. Mary & Frank went to Greenville

div3.head: 29. Wed.
div3.p: Went to Staunton. Called to see Mrs Stribling & Mrs McClung. Made some small purchases. It began to rain about sunset & rained heavily in the night.

div3.head: March 1. Th.
div3.p: Day mild. Reading writing & working.

div3.head: 2. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Pleasant day.

div3.head: 3. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Very mild. Shower.

div3.head: 4. Sab.
div3.p: Windy Preached at Bethel to a good Congn & very attentive. Called to see Mrs Stover.

div3.head: 5. Mon.
div3.p: Writing & reading. Pleasant.

div3.head: 6. Tu.
div3.p: Plowed a land in the N.W. field. Executed a Will for John Hays & Articles of agreement between John Hays & James M. Hays. Dined at Wm. L. Smith's. Pd. Bumgarner & Mc Clure in full and % A. Lightner's Act for smithwork & Wm. Hess for repairing waggon visited John Brownlee.

div3.head: March 7. Wed.
div3.p: Wrote to Henry A. Kerr N.Y. and enclosed a letter to the Agt of the Carbon Oil Co. & $5.25 to buy Oil. Rode to Mint Spring & settled with Mr Gardner to this date.

div3.head: 8. Thurs.
div3.p: A cloud in the W. & Thunder. It passed round N. & Mrs McF & I set off for Greenville. It began to rain Moderately & gradually increased. I went to the sale of the Miss Soak's property. Dined at Alexr. Brownlee's. Returned home.

div3.head: 9. Fr.
div3.p: Day cold with snow showers. Reading & studying.

div3.head: 10. Sat.
div3.p: Very cold. Plowing near the springhouse. Studying.

div3.head: 11. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a good & attentive Congn.

div3.head: 12. Mon.
div3.p: In the morning mild; wind W. but in the afternoon it turned S. Fell to the freezing point. Studying question in the Confession of Faith.

div3.head: 13. Tu.
div3.p: Cold Called at Jas. McClungs. Dined at Mr Patterson. Attended my Catechising at Broadhead S. H. Called at Mr Wallace. Spent the night at Mr McClure's.

div3.head: 14. Wed.
div3.p: Called at Mr Mc. Mrs McGaff Doaks. Dined at Mr Merritts. Home.

div3.head: March 15. Th.
div3.p: working. Held a Catechising at Mt. Ida.

div3.head: 16. Fr.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 17. Sat.
div3.p: Was summoned by J. East to attend in Greenville as a witness in a suit between him & John J. Beard about the price of Mat-horse. Beard did not come & the case was postponed. Dined at Mr Smith's. Home at 3 P.M. Studying.

div3.head: 18. Sab.
div3.p: It began to rain early & rained so much that I did not go to Bethel, not expecting a Congn. My sons went there were 34 persons there. Messrs Pilson & Brownlee held a Prayer meeting. Rained all day.

div3.head: 19. Mon.
div3.p: Rained moderately all last night & all day to day till sunset. I recorded 5 pages of minutes of Synod.

div3.head: 20. Tu.
div3.p: Mrs McFarland and James went to Bethel to clean the Church. Robert & Jefferson work on the road to the Ch. I recorded 6 pages.

div3.head: 21. W.
div3.p: Mary & Robert went to Staunton. I recording minutes 4 pages. Wrote & enclosed a Gold Dollar for the Journal of Commerce. Wrote to Dr. White, J.L. Campbell, Rev. Mr Pinney and Col. Wm C. Patterson.

div3.head: March 22. Th.
div3.p: Sowed Oats near the spring-house. Writing & working.

div3.head: 23. F.
div3.p: Mrs McF & Mary & James & Robt & Frank went to Bethel about carpeting the Church. Sowed oats at the foot of the front meadow. I was working & reading. Plowing for corn. Mrs McFarland did not come home.

div3.head: 24. Sat.
div3.p: Studying & reading. Mrs McF came home.

div3.head: 25. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a good Congn with some liberty. Day chilly.

div3.head: 26. Mon.
div3.p: Mrs McF & I went to Staunton & James took the waggon & brought home a Bl. Allum water which Mr Burrows sent me gratis. Also 5 gals. Carbon Oil from the Carbon Oil Company N.Y. Cost 85 cents per Gal there: vessel one dollar-changes to Staunton $1.25=$6.50 being $1.0 per Gal. Also 800 Wt. Plaster of Paris ground=at $12 per ton=Tol $4.35. Took my trunk to be repaired. Took an Oil can & sent it by Wm L. Smith to Richmond for flaxseed Oil. Dined at Col. Tates. Snow shower.

div3.head: 27. Tu.
div3.p: Went to see John Thompson who is very ill. Visited Alexr Brownlee's family Conversed with Mary & Mrs Wilson on who contemplate joining the Church.

div3.head: March 27. Tu. Continued.
div3.p: Called at John Larew's whose daughter proposed to join the Church. Brought home 50 lb. keg of pure white lead. Cost in Richmond $4.88.

div3.head: 28. Wed.
div3.p: Went to see Mrs James Hall who has been very unwell. Pd. Mr Hall for some time Roda was with us in 1848 $2.70 & for a piece of Beeswax 30 cents =$3.00. He gave me .50 for Missions.

div3.head: 29. Th.
div3.p: Went to see John Thompson he is worse I fear will not recover. Dined at Adam Hawpe's. Had an interesting conversation with him about joining the Church. Called at John & Saml Hays' talked to the young.

div3.head: 30. Fr.
div3.p: John P. McClure came to let me know that John L. Thompson died last night at 9.15 O'clock. Studying-Plowing for corn.

div3.head: 31. Sat.
div3.p: I preached at the funeral of John L. Thompson, one of my warmest friends who died in a weeks sickness. I trust he was a pious man though not a member of the Church. I urged from his example the importance of a profession of religion.

div3.head: April 1st. Sab.
div3.p: Rained in the morning about 10 abated. Mrs McF. staid at home. I preached at Bethel to a thin Congn. & with more liberty than usual. Spent the night at John Brownlee's.

div3.head: 2. Mon.
div3.p: Visited Saml Humphreys who is very low. Fears are entertained that he may not recover. His mind is perfectly calm. Visited Mrs Patterson Mr McClung (Mr Jas Gilkeson & wife there Mrs Wilson-A Brownlee's family & Mr Britain's.

div3.head: 3. Tu.
div3.p: At home feel fatigued. Wrote to Betsey, Dr Wm Brown & Rev J. Doll. Mary & Robert went to Staunton.

div3.head: 4. Wed.
div3.p: Rained till near noon. Clear. Sowed cloverseed near the Springhouse. I was reading and working.

div3.head: 5. Th.
div3.p: Finished plowing for corn. I was working. In the afternoon visited at Samuel Hays' to converse with the young people. Found the girls very tender on the subject of Religion. Wind very high.

div3.head: 6. Fr.
div3.p: Last night I was quite unwell & this morning did not rise till near 9 o'clock. Could do little.

div3.head: 7. Sat.
div3.p: Studying-my sons went to muster. Harrowing for corn.

div3.head: April 8. Sab.
div3.p: Went to Bethel the session met & recd into the Communion of the Church Sarah Jane Hays and Susan Margaret Hays, daughter of Samuel Hays, the Elder. Also Mary Susan Brownlee & Melissa Ann Brownlee, daughters of Alexr Brownlee, the Elder. Also Mary Elisabeth Larew, daughter of John B. Also Adam M. Hawpe. Glory to God for this privilege. Baptized Miss Larew.
Preached to a large & attentive Cong. Dined at M. Pilsons. Preached at C.C. Schoolhouse to a full house. Came home somewhat fatigued. But thankful to God for the ability to labour in his vineyard.

div3.head: 9. Mon.
div3.p: Wrote to the Editors of the Journal of Commerce which has failed to come for two weeks & I fear the money sent has miscarried. Wrote to F.N. Watkins Esqr about a school for Robert. Also to Wm. D. Blanton, who advertises for a Teacher. Went to Greenville & made various purchases of Lightner & Co. Called at Mr Bumgarners. Home. Marking out for Corn in NW field.

div3.head: 10. Tu.
div3.p: Called to preach at the Funeral of John Christ, aged 90 years. A very fine shower about 5 P.M. Marking for corn in front of the house.

div3.head: April 11. Wed.
div3.p: The Presby. of Lexington met at Bethel Church-a full meeting. A good Sermon was preached at the opening by Rev. E. Thomas.
Dr White & his son Henry, Dr. Wm. Brown & Mr. Saml Brown came & spent the night with us.

div3.head: 12. Th.
div3.p: day cool-attended Pby. Rev. W.E. Baker preached a good Sermon on the words of Peter-Master, we have toiled all night & have caught nothing &c. Prayers & exhortations by Dr White & Mr S. Brown. Dr Brown Messrs Miller Richardson & Lawson & Elder Hasseldon here all night.

div3.head: 13. Fr.
div3.p: Attended Pby. Mr Henry M. White was examined on Theology & the Sacrament & Ch. History & the Ch. Govt by me-read a Lecture & delivered a Popular Sermon & was Licensed. Rev. Enoch Thomas preached a good Missionary Sermon & a Collection of $47.42 was recd.
Had no company home with us.

div3.head: 14. Sat.
div3.p: Attended Pby & closely engaged all day. Session met & Virginia Ruth Gilkeson was recd also David Brainard McClung & Jeffery a Servt of Adam Hawpe aged about 78. Rev. John Miller a good Sermon rather too metaphysical on God So loved the world &c John 3:16. Mr Blain & Mr King with us.
The Presbytery adjourned about 5 P.M. after a harmonious delightful Session.

div3.head: April 15th. Sab .
div3.p: The Session met at 10 a.m. and recd on Examn Thomas M. Crosen who had been a probationer for a month in the Methodist E. Ch. South. Also James Thomas J. Gillum & Eugenia E. Sproul. Dr White preached a good Sermon on Eph. 2:13 "For by him we both have access by one spirit into the Father." Rev. Saml Brown introduced the Comn & Mr. Blain dispensed the cup & made a good address & Mr Thomas closed the services. We have great reason for the thankfulness for being permitted to receive Twelve on Examn. the largest number for many years. All the Glory to God. Mr Blain spent the night with us.

div3.head: 16. Mon.
div3.p: Feel a great sense of fatigue. Reading & writing.

div3.head: 17. Tu.
div3.p: Still feel a sense of fatigue. Began to plant corn on the W. side of the NW field-droping ashes & Plaster in the hill.

div3.head: 18. Wed.
div3.p: Cool & threatening. Planting corn. I was writing Minutes of Synod.

div3.head: 19. Th.
div3.p: Rain. Finished the Minutes of Synod. ready for the Genl Assembly.

div3.head: 20. Fri.
div3.p: Finished planting Corn in the NW Field & commenced in front of the house with corn got from Ira Swatsby.

div3.head: 21. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Finished planting corn. Planted about half an acre of Sorgum below the waggon shed.

div3.head: 22. Sab.
div3.p: A delightful day. Preached at Bethel to a large Congn. an earnest Sermon. May God Bless it.

div3.head: 23. Mon.
div3.p: Cool. Went to Staunton. Court day. Attended to various matters of business. Dined with Mrs Campbell.

div3.head: 24. Tu.
div3.p: Visited with Mrs McF at Mr McClung's-he is suffering more. Ben has been very unwell with Pneumonia, is improving. Dined there.
At Mrs Pattersons to tea. Phebe has returned is very feeble, but better. He is improving.

div3.head: 25. Wed.
div3.p: Frost. Visited at Andw McClungs L.C. Gilkeson's & dined at Alxr Brownlees. Bought a large Bill of Goods from Lightner & Co. Then home. Articles for Robert value = $7.30.

div3.head: 26. Th.
div3.p: Cold. Went to Staunton, also Robt & James. Got a ton (1100 lbs) of Plaster & various other articles. Had my Buggy tires all cut & new Bolts $4.00.

div3.head: Apl. 26. continued
div3.p: A Coat of Casimere for Robt $4.50 Vest, Do. 1.75 Trunk for Do. $5.00. 75 feet of Old sprouting at 5 cents =$3.75. Paid Wm. J. Gilkeson a Note of F.W. McFarland for $87.12 dated March 19th 1857 & 8 years interest= $15.68. Sum paid $102.80. Mrs McF. & Mary &c. at Mr Gilkeson's.

div3.head: 27. Fr.
div3.p: Still cool. Visited Samuel Pilson who has had an attack of Drysepela. Dined at Adam Hawpes. Went to Granville & home, calling at Mr J. Bumgarners.

div3.head: 28. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Sowing Plaster.

div3.head: 29. Sab.
div3.p: Cool. Preached at Bethel to a moderate Congn. In the afternoon at Mt. Ida to a very full house. Had sore mouth.

div3.head: 30. Mon.
div3.p: Weary. Reading & writing letters of introduction for Robert who is going to Cumberland County in this state to teach in the family of Wm. D. Blanton, who is well recommended to me by F. N. Watkins Esqr and offers Robert $200 for a session of eight months. The No. of Scholars will not exceed 10 or 12. Board &c. found.

div3.head: May 1. Tu.
div3.p: A good rain this morning. I gave Robert $20 for expenses &c. &c. He is pretty well supplied with Cloathing.

div3.head: May 1st. Tu. Continued.
div3.p: After dinner James took Robert & his baggage to Staunton on his way to his place of business i.e. teaching.

div3.head: 2. Wed.
div3.p: Day cool & unpleasant. Reading.

div3.head: 3. Thurs.
div3.p: Planted some Potatoes on this side of the N.W. field. Mrs McFarland & I went to Middlebrook-dined at Mr Gardner's. Called on Rev. Mr Crawford-Mrs Randolph & Mrs Dr Wm. McChesney. Spent the night at Mrs Sprouls. Col S.V. Emaline only at home.

div3.head: 4. Fr.
div3.p: Mild & pleasant Spring morning. Called a few minutes at Mr Bumgarners, & came home to dinner.

div3.head: 5. Sat.
div3.p: Pleasant spring day. Studying but dull. Mary & James went to Greenville & Mrs Pattersons.

div3.head: 6. Sab.
div3.p: Warm. Preached at Bethel to a good & attentive Congn. Dined at Dr. Tates & preached in Greenville to a large Congn. Mrs McFarland & I spent the night Mr Ballard Smith's.

div3.head: 7. Mon.
div3.p: Very warm. Mr B. Smith & wife went with us to James Smith's. Dined there. Visited Saml Pilson. Recd letters from Robert & Betsey.

div3.head: 8. Tu.
div3.p: Resting & reading.

div3.head: May 9th. Wed.
div3.p: There was a light shower early this morning and damp through the day. Hauling for 3 days Locusts for Pastr &c to the sawmill.
I wrote letters to Drs Musgrave, Chenler & J. Leighton Scelson-also the Genl. Patterson & my son Robert.

div3.head: 10. Th.
div3.p: Two very heavy showers-were much needed & will do great good. Reading & studying a little.

div3.head: 11. Fr.
div3.p: Damp & sleight showers. Studying. Went to see Mrs Col. Wilson who has suffered much with Eruption, is better. Went to the P.O. Recd a letter from Francis.

div3.head: 12. Sat.
div3.p: Pleasant. Studying.

div3.head: 13. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel with a good deal of liberty. Dined at A.F. Humphreys. Called to see Saml H. he is improving. Preached at Broadhead to a full house. Spent the night at Andw. McClung's.

div3.head: 14. Mon.
div3.p: called on Mrs Patterson & Phebe. The latter I fear cannot live long. Called at D.C. Gilkeson's, James McClung's Dined at Wm. Smith's. Called to see Saml Hays. A letter from Dr. Humphreys.

div3.head: 15. Tu.
div3.p: Languid & not well. Reading. Some girls took tea here.

div3.head: May 16. Wed.
div3.p: Pleasant. Went to see Jack Thomason & his wife who are greatly afflicted. Visited Mr Cocharan's family. He is still suffering from the effects of his injury. Called on Mrs Bumgarner.

div3.head: 17. Th.
div3.p: Hazy. Mr Latshaw here repairing my Chimney-wall. I had an appointment to preach at John Hays' & went as far as Saml Hays' when a tremendous Rain fell accompanied with hail. It did much damage. My fences were swept & low-grounds covered.

div3.head: 18. Fr.
div3.p: Mr Latshaw finished. I was studying & reading. Wrote to Francis.

div3.head: 19. Sat.
div3.p: Cool. Mrs McF & I went to Middlebrook to the meeting of the Classes of the German Reformed Ch. I was invited to sit as a Corresponding member. Heard the Rev. Mr Martin preach a tolerable sermon.
Mr Martin appointed to preach for me on the Sab. Introduced to Mr Tetzel of Shepherdstown & Mr Rinker of Shanandoah. Only 6 Ministers present & 2 absent.

div3.head: 20. Sab.
div3.p: Pleasant. Mr Martin preached a good Sermon from "Thy kingdom come." I preached at the house of the late Jno. Thompson to a large Congn. of Negros. Mrs McF staid at Blackwood.

div3.head: May 21. Mon.
div3.p: Went with Mary to see Mrs. Col. Wilson who is confined to bed & has strange symptoms. I fear occasioned by continuing to long to use Fowler's Solution of Arsenic. She took as high as 15 drops 3 times a day & for 4 or 5 days after it produced swelling all over. She has a distressing pricking in her hands & feet.
Took my Boots & Slippers to Patton to be soled. Called at Hayden's & to see Wm. Garrison, who I fear is to die of consumption.

div3.head: 22. Tu.
div3.p: Languid. Reading. Finished replanting corn.

div3.head: 23. Wed.
div3.p: In the corn with the Cultivator in front of the house.
Called at Saml Hays'-got Judge's fore Shoes removed. Dined at Dr Tate's. The Dr took out a tooth for me. Made some Calls. Home.

div3.head: 24. Th.
div3.p: Not very well. Studying. This is the day for electing a Judge & County Officers. Mrs McF came home.

div3.head: 25. Fr.
div3.p: had a distressing cough last night. Preached at John Hays. Patton mended my Boots & Slippers. Pd. James Hays for 2 Bs. of long red Potatoes $1.50. Mrs E. Brown came.

div3.head: 26. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: May 27. Sab.
div3.p: Cloudy & warm. Preached at Bethel to a good Congn Had good attention. Dined at Reuben Lamberts. Mrs Mary Wallace there also. Rain prevented me from going to preach at C.C. Schoolhouse.

div3.head: 28. Mon.
div3.p: Charming day. Plowing corn. Went to see Mrs Col. Wilson & found her a little better. Prayed with her. Called to see Wm. Garrison who is sinking & I fear is skeptical & now too low I fear to receive new light.

div3.head: 29. Tu.
div3.p: Pleasant day. Reading & working.

div3.head: 30. Wed.
div3.p: Cloudy & light Showers. Repairing my sewing Machine. About noon Rev. John S. Blain came & spent the night with us.

div3.head: 31. Th.
div3.p: Mr. Blain left us. The day is very pleasant. Went to see W. Garrison who is sinking & Mrs Wilson who is better.

div3.head: June 1. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Planted corn among the Sorgum.

div3.head: 2. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 3. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel & in Greenville & returned home. Mrs McFarland went to Mr Morrill's.

div3.head: June 4. Mon.
div3.p: Went to Staunton. Mary with me.

Paid Merideth for repairing Mrs McFarlands watch $10.00. Pd. Adam's Express for taking a watch to Farmville for Robt. $1.25. Paid for repairing my trunk $1.50 Paid for 20 lbs of fence Nails $1.00. Horse .25 Dined at J. Ad. Waddell's met with Several of the Baptist ministers of the Virginia Association and sat in their meeting sometimes. A shower & high wind.

div3.head: 5. Tu.
div3.p: Tired. Reading.

Called to see Saml Hays who is I think in a critical state. Went to John Brownlee's for Mrs McF. walked over to the late residence of John Brownlee who died yesterday. The Funeral had just moved off. Went & Dined at John P. McClure's. Came home.

div3.head: 7. Thurs.
div3.p: Reading.

div3.head: 8. Fr.
div3.p: Had Company Mrs + Lizzie & Cris. Merritt + Mrs Dr. Tate & Mrs Wm Smith Mrs Lovey Tate Mrs Woods & Sally Gilkeson.

div3.head: 9. Sat.
div3.p: Not well. Feverish. Dined at Ballard Smith's Spent the night at Mr McClung Patton's.

div3.head: June 10. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Timberrridge to a full house who gave good attention. Supplying a Sab. for Rev. W. Trimble, who is absent in Missouri.
These three days have been very cool. I went home with Maj. A. B. Stuart & Spent the night there & was very kindly treated. I am not well.

div3.head: 11. Mon.
div3.p: Called an hour at Dr. Morrison's. Reached Mrs Sproul's at 11.40 a.m. Dined. Called at Bumgarner's & reached home at 4.40 p.m. fatigued. There was a little frost this morning.
Intelligence reached me this evening at 6 O'clock that Mr Saml Humphreys died about 1.15 p.m. Alas, Alas, one of my oldest warmest friends. But he has departed to be with Christ.

div3.head: 12. Tu.
div3.p: I was quite unwell last night & am unwell today. We all went to the Funeral of Samuel Humphrey & I preached to a large assembly. Then visited Mrs Patterson & Phebe & Mr McClung & family. I came home fatigued but better.

div3.head: 13. Wed.
div3.p: An excellent rain from morning till noon. Reading only.

div3.head: 14. Th.
div3.p: I am still feeble. Reading only.

div3.head: 15. Fr.
div3.p: Studying a little. Taking cold.

div3.head: 16. Sat.
div3.p: Quite unwell-distressing cough.

div3.head: June 16. Sat. continued.
div3.p: I was summoned to Greenville as a witness in a case between John J. Beard & Mr East. I went though unwell. My testimony was of no avail. Dined at Wm F. Smith's & came home quite unwell & went to bed.

div3.head: 17. Sab.
div3.p: Spent a very uncomfortable night. Did not rise till 1 p.m.-very weak. Disappointed a large Congn. for which I am sorry. Dr. Tate came to see us & prescribed for Rhoda who is very ill with Pneumonia.

div3.head: 18. Mon.
div3.p: I am very feeble; can do nothing & seem to gather no strength. Rhoda very ill; cannot live long without a change. Sent for Dr Tate, he came & bled Rhoda which relieved her breathing.

div3.head: 19. Tu.
div3.p: I am no better. Feel such inward weakness. Thought a ride would do me good & set off to visit the Sick, but had to return back. Rhoda somewhat better. Dr Tate came & prescribed farther for Rhoda.

div3.head: 20. Wed.
div3.p: I am better. Went to James Hall's. Dined at Saml Hays. Visited Mrs Col. Wilson Went to the Post Office. The mail brought a letter from Betsey from Newbern. They have left Sharon. Mr Gardner paid me $32.30 collected as Salary for me & which I allowed him to retain. Visited Wm Garrison.

div3.head: June 21. Th.
div3.p: I am febler than yesterday. Dr. Tate again called to see Rhoda. She is perhaps a little better. Col. Lilley spent a couple of hours with me. An excellent rain in the evening.

div3.head: 22. Fr.
div3.p: It rained much in the night. I am studying a little. Dr. Tate here to see Rhoda again. A letter & likeness from Francis.

div3.head: 23. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Mowing.

div3.head: 24. Sab.
div3.p: I am still feeble. Preached at Bethel to a large Congn. & I think with my usual energy. Dined at Mr Pilsons. Preached again at the Sch. house to a large & very attentive audience. Then rode home & perhaps stronger than in the morning!!! Glory to God.

div3.head: 25. Mon.
div3.p: Reading.

div3.head: 26. Tu.
div3.p: At 8 a.m. left home for Lexington. Called at Mrs Sproul's. Dined at Dr. Morrison's. Reached Col. Reid's before sunset. Very kindly received. Attended the prayer meeting & delivered an address.

div3.head: 27. Wed.
div3.p: Trustees of Washn. Col. met. I & Dr Wm Brown dined at Dr. Junkin's. Took tea at Wm. White's.

div3.head: 28. Th.
div3.p: Attended the Commencement. Spent the night at Rev. Mr Trimble's.

div3.head: June 29th.
div3.p: Called at Dr. Morrison's. Dined at Mrs Sprouls-home at 4 p.m.

div3.head: 30. Sat.
div3.p: Not well. Dr. Wm. Brown with us last night.

div3.head: July 1. Sab.
div3.p: I am very feeble. Preached a long Sermon at Bethel. Much exhausted.

div3.head: 2. Mon.
div3.p: I am still very weak, could not go to visit the sick. Reading. James & Jef. cutting our miserable crop of Wheat. Lizzie Merritt here.

div3.head: 3. Tu.
div3.p: A pleasant shower this morning. I am better. Visited Mrs Wilson, Ann Hayden & Wm. Garrison.

div3.head: 4. Wed.
div3.p: Mowing. I am better. Reading &c.

div3.head: 5. Th.
div3.p: Employed as yesterday.

div3.head: 6. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Mr Merritt came & took away Lizzie. In the evening a drizzling rain commenced.

div3.head: 7. Sat.
div3.p: Did not rain in the night but this morning began & rained moderately for some time. Studying.

div3.head: 8. Sab.
div3.p: Had Asthma last night & had to sit up much. But preached at Bethel to a Large Congn. Preached at Jas. McClung's & then came home.

div3.head: July 9. Mon.
div3.p: Rested well but had Ashma badly after I woke & have felt it a little all day. Mowing the meadow in front. I have done nothing but read.

div3.head: 10. Tu.
div3.p: Mary & I went to Staunton. I got the Spring of my Buggy mended at Hardy's & a rod before. Cost $2.00. Dined at Mr Doyle's. Called on Mrs Baldwin widow & prayed with her. Recd 24 dolls, my first half year's dividend on 8 Shares Virginia State Stocks.

div3.head: 11. Wed.
div3.p: Mrs McF & I went to see Phebe Patterson. She is declining. Call at Mr McClungs & visited Alexr Brownlee who is suffering with inflamatory Rheumatism. Warm.

div3.head: 12. Th.
div3.p: Began to rain early & continued moderately till about noon. Reading.

div3.head: 13. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Hauling in hay.

div3.head: 14. Sat.
div3.p: Finished hauling hay. Not well. Trying to study.

div3.head: 15. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to an immense Congn. Good attention. Dined at Saml. Hays' preached at Mt. Ida S.H. to a large Congn. Came home much fatigued.

div3.head: 16. Mon.
div3.p: Put Castors on Jas. Hall's Bedstead. Visited Sally Daugherty & Mrs Wilson. Cut our Oats an excellent crop.

div3.head: July 17. Tu.
div3.p: Preached at Mrs Selors' at the funeral of Wm Garrison, a young man who died of Consumption. The assembly was large.
Dined at John Hays'. Got my horses shod &c & made some purchases in Greenville. Sent my horse Bob to Mr Lightner to sell for me.

div3.head: 18. Wed.
div3.p: Saw the eclipse of the Sun. Mrs McF & I went & dined at Archd A. Sprouls-Mrs Bumgardner & Mrs Mish there. Came home.

div3.head: 19. Th.
div3.p: This the warmest day for four years. Mr James W. Hudson & wife dined with us. Finished getting in our Oats (100 Doz) & so our whole harvest. Thanks be to God.

About 4 p.m. I walked to the Stable with Mr Hudson without my hat & soon felt my head much affected although I had held my handkerchief on it all the way. It continued till I went to bed. A sleight shower.

div3.head: 20. Fr.
div3.p: My head very uncomfortable all day-wet it often. Read a little. James & Mary went to Mrs Pattersons.*

div3.head: 21. Sat.
div3.p: The warmest morning for 2 yrs. My head better. Studying.
*Remitted to Rev. Dr. M.D. Hoge $184.00 to buy for me two Shares of Virginia State Stock.

div3.head: July 22. Sab.
div3.p: I am better. Preached at Bethel & then at the School house in Greenville. There were showers today. Dined at A. W. McClure's. Came home.

div3.head: 23. Mon.
div3.p: Feel very dull. A fine shower. Sold my mare Jenny to Mr Campbell of Nelson for $8. I paid $40 for her ten years ago. She is probably 24 years old.

div3.head: 24. Tu.
div3.p: I had asthma last night. Spent most of this day oiling my Buggy harness.
Recd a letter from Betsey from Columbia, Tennessee. Dated 17th inst. Where the family had arrived in safety the day before. Thanks be to God.

div3.head: 25. Wed.
div3.p: Had Asthma badly last night. Spent the day reading. James went to the mountain for whortleberries.
I wrote an earnest letter to Hon. Henry A. Edmondson about the necessity of of the Speedy Settlement of Dr. Leides' estate.

div3.head: 26. Th.
div3.p: Had Asthma all last night. The Corn is dying from drought. Prospect bad. Mary & Mary Lou left home to go to David Kunkle's to drink allum water. James took them to Staunton. Dr. Brown & wife spent the night with us.

div3.head: 27. Fr.
div3.p: Asthma again last night. Very feeble & feverish today. Can do nothing in the way of study.

div3.head: July 28. Sat.
div3.p: Still very feeble but no Asthma. Can study very little.
Recd from Dr. M.D. Hoge a certificate of Va. State Stock of $200. Cost $183.75. In the afternoon was utterly incapacitated for Study on any effort. To bed early.

div3.head: 29. Sab.
div3.p: A very warm morning with a South wind. Clouds, but no rain. I am not a whit stronger than I was yesterday. It seems very doubtful whether I should attempt to go to Ch. 10 a.m. I have concluded that it is not my duty to attempt to go to Bethel. I am too weak. Wm. J. Gilkerson came to see me. In the afternoon a little stronger.

div3.head: 30. Mon.
div3.p: I am no better-very weak. I can scarcely read. Wrote letters to Mrs A.E. May & to Dr. M.D. Hoge. Rhoda has been very ill since Saturday

div3.head: 31. Tu.
div3.p: I am a little better. So is Rhoda. Jacob Vanlear came about 10 a.m. & staid till about 6 p.m.

div3.head: Aug 1. Wed.
div3.p: I am better. Went to see Saml Hays who has been worse but is now better. Went to Greenville. Got Mr Yates to mend my harnass-75 cents. Pd. Dr. Churchman's Bill-50 cents. Mr Lightner allows me $22.50 for Bob. Was very unwell coming home. Pulse tonight 110. Mr Stover working.

div3.head: Aug. 2. Th.
div3.p: I spent a very feverish night & am quite unwell today. Can do nothing. Mr Stover is building me an icehouse.

div3.head: 3. Fr.
div3.p: I am some better. Day very warm got a load of Oak plank (800 ft) from David Palmer. Studying a little.

div3.head: 4. Sat.
div3.p: This the warmest day for 4 years. About 3 P.M. had the best rain for two months. Rained about 3/4 of an hour. Thanks be to God. This will help to make some corn the prospect for which was almost hopeless. At the same time there was a most destructive flood in Staunton.

div3.head: 5. Sab.
div3.p: Preached in great weakness. No appointment for the afternoon.

div3.head: 6. Mon.
div3.p: I am better. Studying & directing the Carpenter.
A messenger came to inform me of the sudden death of John Gardner.

div3.head: 7. Tu.
div3.p: Mrs McF & I went to Middlebrook. I preached to a large audience. Rev. Mr Crawford followed. Mr Gardner had attended preaching twice on the Sab. Slept well. Rose after sunrise & went feed his pigs & fell at the hog-pen. Was carried apparently lifeless to the house & spoke only, "raise me up." Disease of the heart. Aged 70. A good man.

div3.head: Aug. 8. Wed.
div3.p: Very warm. About noon a pleasant shower & 4 1/2 p.m. a very heavy rain. Did not continue long. I am better. Dr. Tate came to see Rhoda who is very poorly.

div3.head: 9. Th.
div3.p: I am pretty well. Recd a long & satisfactory letter from Betsey from Tennessee.

div3.head: 10. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Plowing stubble ground.

div3.head: 11. Sat.
div3.p: A good deal of rain last night & this morning. Studying.

div3.head: 12. Sab.
div3.p: Cloudy & cool. Preached at Bethel to a good Congn. on the obligations & duties of the Baptized members of the Church. Solemn attention.
Preached at the C.C. School house. About 4 1/2 o'clock it began to rain & continued all the evening. We came home.

div3.head: 13. Mon.
div3.p: It rained all last night & this morning very heavily creating a flood which covered all the low grounds. Continued till near noon, then showery In the afternoon attacked with Asthma.

div3.head: 14. Tu.
div3.p: Had a bad night with Asthma & greatly oppressed through the day.

div3.head: Aug. 15. Wed.
div3.p: Spent another bad night. Did not go to bed till 2 a.m.
Though feeble visited Alexr Brownlee. Conversed with his daughter Margaret Wilson about joining the Church. Called at Adam Hawpe's, Reuben Lamberts, Blackwood & Col. Wilson's.

div3.head: 16. Th.
div3.p: Had another bad night though I remained in bed all night. Today I feel badly. Only reading.

div3.head: 17. Fr.
div3.p: Still very unwell. Last night Mrs McF had a most distressing attack of Cholic & was relieved only by repeated use of Laudanum. She was unable to go to Ch. Dr. Brown preached on "That Rock was Cht." an excellent sermon. He & Emily Link came home with us.

div3.head: 18. Sat.
div3.p: Very unwell. Went to Bethel. The Session recd Elisabeth Swink, wife of Wm, Tirza Elisabeth Lambert, daughter of Reuben & Margaret Estaline Wilson, wife of John W.W. Dr. Brown preached on the fall of Peter.

div3.head: 19. Sab.
div3.p: Still very unwell. Spent a feverish night. The Session recd Mary Margaret Mish & Peggy Ann Lambert on Examn. Mrs Swink & the Miss Lamberts were Baptized. Dr. Brown preached to a large Congn.
It was a pleasant & I think, profitable day.

div3.head: Aug. 20th. Mon.
div3.p: Still unwell but I think a little Better. I am doing nothing but reading Newspapers. A very heavy rain in the afternoon.

div3.head: 21. Tu.
div3.p: I am too feeble to visit the sick. Showers. About 5 p.m. a very heavy Rain. A flood came down by the Springhouse greater than I have ever seen, opening the fences both above & below.

div3.head: 22. Wed.
div3.p: Last night I was very unwell. Have to lie half my my time. A thick fog this morning.

div3.head: 23. Th.
div3.p: A little better. Another fog. Went to the sale of John Thompson's estate. I bought an excellent Old fashioned 8 day Clock for $5 & a Cupboard for $3 & some Books, & a little Table. The concourse was very great.
I visited Sally Daugherty who has been paralized.

div3.head: 24. Fr.
div3.p: Studying. Still better.

div3.head: 25. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. James went to Staunton Mrs McFarland gave me $5 in part payment of repairing her watch. Col. Lilley dined here. He is taking the Census.

div3.head: 26. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a good & attentive Congn. on the duty of Walking in Christ.

div3.head: Aug. 27. Mon.
div3.p: Visited Phebe Patterson James McClung & Alexr Brownlee. Also Sally Tate at Andw McClungs & dined there. Took tea at Bumgarner's & came home.

div3.head: 28. Tu.
div3.p: Preached at Saml. McAdden's at the Funeral of Sally Daugherty, a member of the Seceder Church, aged 75. She was a good woman.
Several showers today.

div3.head: 29. Wed.
div3.p: Brought home the Articles bought at the Sale of John L. Thompson. The heirs made me a present of all I bought but the clock ($5) a gratuity of $4.55. Thanks be to God for such kind friends. Joseph M. Colling & his mother came to see us today.

div3.head: 30. Th.
div3.p: Mrs C. & Son spent the day with us. I have scarcely ever seen any one more grateful than Mrs C. is to Mrs McF & myself for the kindness we shewed her in former years, and her son is very kind. In the evening sent them to Mr Gilkeson's on their way to Staunton.
Had Asthma last night.

div3.head: 31. Fr.
div3.p: Sent our friends to Staunton. I am studying.

div3.head: Sept 1. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. In the evening I married George, servt of Peter Strouse to Annie servt to Wm. J. Gilkeson.

div3.head: 2. S.
div3.p: I am quite unwell. Preached at Bethel a Solemn Serm on the duty of the wicked. In the afternoon preached at Mrs Sproul's to a good Congn. But I feel exceedingly broken down & spent a miserable night.

div3.head: 3. Mon.
div3.p: Raining heavily this morning. Staid at Mrs S's till 2 p.m. came home. Another bad night.

div3.head: 4. Tu.
div3.p: So unwell, I did not rise till the afternoon & then could sit up but little. Mrs Lovey Tate & Mrs Tate & Sallie Gilkeson dined here.

div3.head: 5. W.
div3.p: Spent another bad night. Did not rise till noon. Am exceedingly weak.

div3.head: 6. Th.
div3.p: Rested better last night but feel extreme prostration. Sent James to enquire after Mr Brawford's health who has been very ill but is much better.

div3.head: 7. Fr.
div3.p: Rested very badly last night. Lay in bed till 10 a.m. I am a little better. Mrs McF. & James went to Staunton.

div3.head: 8. Sat.
div3.p: Still very weak. Finished plowing for wheat. Studying a little.

div3.head: 9. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel in great weakness. I wondered that any strength held out as it did for an hour preaching with my usual animation. Solemn attention & some feeling. Much exhausted.
In the afternoon Cyrus Wilson, servt to Wm. F. Smith & Nancy Occurt, servt to John Merritt came to my house & I married them.

div3.head: 10. Mon.
div3.p: A little stronger. Went to visit Mr Brawford who is better. One of his children is ill with Fever.
Mrs McFarland & I dined at Mr Bumgarners with Mr Saml McCorkle & wife & Son & daughter.
Got 20 Bushs of Mediteranean Wheat for seed from Col. Sproul.

div3.head: 11. Tu.
div3.p: Took Mrs McF. to Mrs Pattersons's & I attended the sale at Humphrys. Called to see Sally Tate who is quite ill & Phebe Patterson who is better.

div3.head: 12. Wed.
div3.p: Went to Staunton. Day Cold. Attended to several items of business.

div3.head: 13. Thurs.
div3.p: A little frost. Had Asthma. Pd. Mr Latshaw for work done 2.50.

div3.head: Sept 14. Fr.
div3.p: Paid Mr Towberman Taxes for 1860 = $32.80 I am still quite unwell.

div3.head: 15. Sat.
div3.p: Finished sowing wheat on the Orchard. Put 10 Bs. on it. The wheat put in in good order. I am better this afternoon. Studying.

div3.head: 16. Sab.
div3.p: I am somewhat stronger. Preached at Bethel & in Greenville. Baptized children of Wm F. Smith. Dr Tate & Mrs Gillum came home.

div3.head: 17. Mon.
div3.p: I am better. It began to rain before day & there was a good rain till noon when it cleared off.

div3.head: 18. Tu.
div3.p: It rained much today. Wind NE. This must be the Equinoctial rain.
Wrote to Dr Dabney Rev. Isaac Todd & Rev. A.D. Hepburn.

div3.head: 19. Wed.
div3.p: I am improving. The men making Cider. I wrote to Joseph M. Wilson & Col. Wm. C. Patterson to Rev. John Johnson. Dined here. A heavy shower after dark.

div3.head: 20. Th.
div3.p: Not so well. Last night there was a very heavy Rain. Mrs McF. Mary & James at Mr Gilkeson's.

div3.head: Sept 21. Fri.
div3.p: Not as well as yesterday. Cutting up the corn in front of the house. Mrs E.H. Brown spent the night with us.

div3.head: 22. Sat.
div3.p: Still unwell-did not rise till after breakfast for two mornings. James went to Staunton.

div3.head: 23. Sab.
div3.p: Still very unwell. Preached at Bethel to a good & attentive Congn. & my usual energy of manner, I think. But felt great exhaustion. Mrs McF. staid at Mr Bumgarner's.
After dinner pulse 107. Went to bed about sunset.

div3.head: 24. Mon.
div3.p: I spent a very feverish restless night. Did not rise till 9 O'clock. Could only read a little. Cutting up corn.

div3.head: 25. Tu.
div3.p: I am rather better. Began to plow Corn ground in front of the house for wheat.

div3.head: 26. Wed.
div3.p: Still better. Mary, James & Frank went to Staunton. I was reading & writing.

div3.head: 27. Thurs.
div3.p: Did not rest well, but am as well as yesterday. About 10 a.m. a very heavy rain with thunder & lightening. Continued with intervals till 3 p.m.

div3.head: 28. Fri.
div3.p: Studying a little. My strength is increasing. Taking Sulpher to prevent the return of the eruption.

div3.head: Sept 29. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 30. Sab.
div3.p: It rained heavily in the night & this morning & moderately all day. I did not go to Bethel. Sent James but he found not one there.

div3.head: October 1. Mon.
div3.p: I am stronger. Visited Mrs Wilson who I fear will not live. Went to the Post Office & recd letters from our three absent children. All well thanks to God.

div3.head: 2. Tu.
div3.p: Visited Alexr Brownlee who is much worse & I fear his Rheumatism is becoming Chronic.
Dined at Dr Tate's. Bought some things visited Mr Brawford's family. They are all better. Home.

div3.head: 3. Wed.
div3.p: Set out for Pby. with Mary & arrived at Augusta Ch. at 10.40. John Miller preached. Staid at Cyrus McCue's. Damp & cool, Wind &c.

div3.head: 4. Th.
div3.p: Rained moderately through the night & today till noon. Mr See preached. Had a conference with Mr Branch.

div3.head: 5. Fr.
div3.p: Damp but cleared off. Some asthma. Mr Price preached a very injudicious Sermon as an Education but on what he called the irrepressible conflict in the Pbn. Ch. I felt under the necessity of saying something to prevent a false impression, which I think all approved.

div3.head: Oct. 6th Sat.
div3.p: Attended Pby. closely. Dr. White Preached. After dinner we came home. I have stood it pretty well.
This week a daughter of Wm. Dunlap's-Jane-died at Mr Trimble's and a daughter of Wm Cochran's-Lettitia-was buried today & I am requested to preach a Funl. Sermon tomorrow.

div3.head: 7. Sab.
div3.p: preached at Bethel to a good Congn. chiefly to the young.

div3.head: 8. Mon.
div3.p: Mrs McF. & I set off for Synod. -James & Mary took us to Staunton. Staid at Col. Tate's.

div3.head: 9. Tu.
div3.p: Fare to Charlottesville 1.80. Called on Mrs Kelly. to Lynchburg 62 Ms. Fare 2.75. Dinner in Charlottesville .50. Staid at Rev. J.B. Ramsey's.

div3.head: 10. Wed.
div3.p: Synod met in the evening. Dr. Moore preached a good Sermon. I nominated Dr. Dabney for Modr & he was elected unanimly.

div3.head: 11. Th.
div3.p: Attended Synod closely all day.

div3.head: 12. Fr.
div3.p: Showers today. In Synod all day. Took tea with Mr Reid & his sisters.

div3.head: 13. Sat.
div3.p: In Synod. Dined at Mr McCorkles. Damp. I have taken cold.

div3.head: 14. Sab.
div3.p:
Quite unwell. Confined to the house all day & missed the delightful
Communion service I have usually enjoyed so much. Day damp. Rain.

div3.head: October 15. Mon.
div3.p: Sent Mrs McF. home with Mr Merritt, & I went on to Salem to see about Mary's business. Reached Salem at 9 a.m. Went to Col. H.A. Edmundsons & was quite unwell all day.

div3.head: 16. Tu.
div3.p: Confined to bed all morning down in the afternoon.

div3.head: 17. Wed.
div3.p: Intended to have gone home today but am not able. In bed till noon.

I arranged many matters with Col. E. & Mr. Blair. Received of Mr M. Blair cash $110.76. Went to Col. Chapman's hotel & slept there till midnight-took the cars at 1.7' a.m. for Lynchburg. Paid .50 for a sleeping berth. Reached Lynchburg at 4.45' a.m. At 5.15' left for Charlottesville. Arrived at 8.50' Breakfasted. Left at 12.20' p.m. Reached home after 4 p.m. much exhausted. But I thank God who has brought me home in safety.

div3.head: 19. Fr.
div3.p: Quite feeble in bed all day. Much rain fell today.

div3.head: 20. Sat.
div3.p: Exceedingly gloomy. Rain. In bed all day.

div3.head: Oct 21. Sab.
div3.p: A very pleasant day but I am confined to bed. Mary & James went to Bethel. A good Congn. & had a good prayer meeting.

div3.head: 22. Mon.
div3.p: I rose this morning but am very weak. Mr Gilkeson & Mr Pilson came to see me. Reading.

div3.head: 23. Tu.
div3.p: A little stronger but cannot begin my writing. N. Burrell here.

div3.head: 24. Wed.
div3.p: Still able to do very little.

div3.head: 25. Th.
div3.p: Better. Remitted to Peter Walker $15.00 for the Biblical Repertory. Finished the abstract of the Minutes of Synod & sent it the Central Presbyterian.

div3.head: 26. Fr.
div3.p: Still better. Studying. Mrs McF. & Mary went to see Mrs Col. Wilson. This evening my Son Robert reached home.

div3.head: 27. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Robert & Mary went to Staunton. I went to see Mrs Col. Wilson who cannot live long.

div3.head: 28. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a good & very attentive Congn. Col. Turk dined with us.

div3.head: 29. Mon.
div3.p: I intended to visit today. But it was damp & finally heavy Rain. Wrote to J.M. Wilson & Mrs Hamersby.

div3.head: Oct 30. Tu.
div3.p: So threatening I could not go to visit.
Mrs Margaret Wilson wife of Col. Wm. Wilson died about 10 A.M. She has suffered much for a year past.

div3.head: 31. Wed.
div3.p: Very Thick fog. Preached at Col. Wilson's at the Funl. of his wife to a very large assembly.

div3.head: Nov 1. Th.
div3.p: This a fast day appointed by our Synod in view of the threatening aspect of our public affairs.
A tolerable congregation assembled at Bethel & we had a Solemn meeting.

div3.head: 2. Fr.
div3.p: The day very wet-frequent & heavy showers-a flood in the night. A great Political meeting in Staunton. James went.

div3.head: 3. Sat.
div3.p: Rev. John F. Baker preached at Bethel from 1 John 1:3. Good sermon & a good Congn. Spent the night with us.

div3.head: 4. Sab.
div3.p: We have recd 3 on Examn. and one on Cert. making 20 on Exmn. during the Year. Glory be to God.
Mr Baker preached a good sermon from John 1:29 Behold the lamb of God, &c.

div3.head: 5. Mon.
div3.p: Frost. Reading.

div3.head: 6. Tu.
div3.p: This the day of the Election of Prest. & Vice Prest. of the U.S. I went to Greenville & voted for Bell & Everett.
I have never voted for Pres. before but for Gen. Harrison. Now I thought it my duty. I feel great anxiety about the result of this election.
Bought a considerable Bill of Goods of Lightner & Co. Dined at Wm Smith's. Visited Alexr Brownlee & spent the night at D.C. Gilkeson's.

div3.head: Nov 7th. Wed.
div3.p: Very cold. Had a bad night with Asthma. Slept little. Visited Phebe Patterson-talked to her & prayed with her. She said with much feeling that my visits were a great comfort to her. I thank God that I have the privilege of Comforting one of Gods Children. Visited Mr Jame McClung. Brought home 50 lbs Rio coffee at 16 1/2 cents & 50 lbs of extra Sugar at 10 1/2 cents. Miss Martha Nichols & Matta Baxter came to visit us.

div3.head: 8. Th.
div3.p: Suffered with Asthma. Could do nothing.

div3.head: 9. Fr.
div3.p: Had a bad night with Asthma. Sat up several hours. Rain from NE. Did not rise till noon.

div3.head: 10. Sat.
div3.p: Still unwell, but no asthma. Can do little but read.

div3.head: 11. Sab.
div3.p: Quite unwell. Preached at Bethel to a good & attentive Congn.

div3.head: Nov 12. Mon.
div3.p: I am better, but can only read.

div3.head: 13. Tu.
div3.p: I spent a feverish night & did not rise till 10 O'clock. Can do nothing today.

div3.head: 14. Wed.
div3.p: I am better. Rev. N.W. Calhoun & his brother James came to seem me & dined. Dr. Wm Brown & wife also. Martha Nichols left us. Robert left home.

div3.head: 15. Th.
div3.p: Mrs Gilkeson & Paris dined here.

div3.head: 16. Fr.
div3.p: Ordered a number of books from Phila. for our Library & Others. I visited Mrs James Wilson-an interesting interview. Went to the Post Office. Dr. Wm Brown came & spent the night. He was dismissed today from his Pastoral Charge with the view of his becoming Editor of the Central Presbyterian. This will be a sore bereavement to me.

div3.head: 17. Sat.
div3.p: Rained in the night & heavily this morning. Dr. & Mrs left us.

div3.head: 18. Sab.
div3.p: Rev. N.W. Calhoun preached for me from Rom. 8:32 He that spared not his own Son &c.-a good sermon & well delivered. Came & dined with us.

div3.head: 19. Mon.
div3.p: Began to prepare the minutes of Synod for the Press. Pulling corn.

div3.head: 20. Tu.
div3.p:
Cold. I went to Staunton Gave a $10 South Carolina Bank
Note (Charleston) to E.M. Taylor to pass off for me as they are depreciated. Also a $10 N. Carolina Note (Wilmington) said to be at a discount. Bought various articles.

div3.head: 21. Nov. Wed.
div3.p: Writing. In the afternoon a brisk snow shower. Got in all the Corn in front of the house.

div3.head: 22. Thurs.
div3.p: Writing. Robert Returned.

div3.head: 23. Fr.
div3.p: About 2 inches of snow fell last night. Rained heavily this morng & moderately through the day. James & Mary went to Greenville & McClung's with things for Mr Branch.

div3.head: 24. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. The coldest day since Feb. 1st last past.

div3.head: 25. Sab.
div3.p: Preached to a small Congn. Cold.

div3.head: 26. Mon.
div3.p: Writing Minutes of Synod. Got in the last of our Corn.

div3.head: 27. Tu.
div3.p: Writing Minutes. Wrote to Jos. P. Engles & G.W. Shanks.

div3.head: 28. Wed.
div3.p: Suffered very much with irritation in my skin. Threatened with eruption. Writing minutes.

div3.head: 29. Th.
div3.p: Still suffering from the irruption. Went to See Phebe Patterson. She is sinking. Had an interesting interview.

div3.head: Nov. 29. Thurs. Continued.
div3.p: Called at James McClungs to see a Box of articles to be sent to Rev. John Branch valued at about $105. The freight by Adams Express will be paid about $61. They gave me $13 in money to send to Mr Branch.
Bought Boyds gray bassinet for Robert.

div3.head: 30. Fr.
div3.p: Writing Minutes. Also wrote to Rev. John Branch with a Check for $13.

div3.head: Dec. 1. Sat.
div3.p: Finished the Minutes of Synod for the press & sent them by mail to Dr. M.D. Hoge to have them printed for me.
Wrote to Dr. Hoge also to Dr. Thos. R. Harris.

div3.head: 2. Sab.
div3.p: Very cold. Robert & James & I went to Hebron. I preached for Mr Baker who is absent at Wheeling. Came home.

div3.head: 3. Mon.
div3.p: Only Reading. Hauling plank.

div3.head: 4. Tu.
div3.p: Repairing little. Table & Reading.

div3.head: 5. Wed.
div3.p: Went to Greenville Bought a pair of Boots for Jess for $3. Dined at Dr Tates. Suffering much with the eruption on my legs. This getting decidedly worse.

div3.head: 6. Th.
div3.p: My legs worse. Rested badly-lay in bed till 9 1/2 O'clock. Had to sit with my feet up all day & then very uneasy.

div3.head: 7. Fr.
div3.p: At 7 a.m. James & I set of for Staunton arrived at 9. Got the Box of books from Phila . At 9.45 took the car of the freight train for Pond Gap. Dined at McKunkles. Rode to Mr Crawford's & was kindly recd. Got Miss Harriet's room, the best.
Drank sulphur water freely. Rested better than for several nights.

div3.head: 8. Sat.
div3.p: Reading & drinking. I am certainly better already.

div3.head: 9. Sab.
div3.p: Rested well. Though not quite so comfortable today. The eruption is dried up. Spent the day in my room, reading &c. The day chilly & uncomfortable. Some watery pimples.

div3.head: 10. Mon.
div3.p: Raining & it rained heavily half the day. Chilly & gloomy. Legs dry & better in the morning-about 3 pm became hot.

div3.head: 11. Tu.
div3.p: Cleared off cooler-spitting snow. I am better.

div3.head: 12. Wed.
div3.p: My legs not so well. The Sulphur water is very diuretic. Took salts.

div3.head: 13. Th.
div3.p: My legs seem better in the morning but swell much in the afternoon. It is so painful for me to walk that I feel a good deal discouraged.

div3.head: 14. Fr.
div3.p: Very cold. I rested badly the first part of last night, legs so uneasy. Seem better this morning but uncomfortable.

div3.head: Dec. 14. Fr. Continued.
div3.p: It is a singular fact that these cold mornings the water from the Sulphur spring has neither taste nor smell of Sulphur. In the evening it has. Mr Condin & his wife & three little sons living here. Mr & Mrs Morris here. Harriet the oldest daughter single.

div3.head: 15. Sat.
div3.p: It began to snow after midnight & continued till 10 a.m. say 7 inches deep. At 10 I prepared to depart. No pay was allowed to be made. I have been very kindly & generously treated. May God reward my benefactors.

Mr. Condin took me to the Depot. Dined at McKunkle's. Took the Cars a little after 12 noon. A wood train retarded us. Arrived at Swoope's Depot at 3 P.M. & had to stay there till 4 1/2 P.M. At 5 reached Staunton. James had just gone home. Spent the night at Addison Waddell's miserably though kindly treated. Expenses $1.55+50+10.

div3.head: 16. Sab.
div3.p: Heard Mr. Wm F. Baker preach. Col. Tate sent me his horse & Buggy & I came home. My Eruption seems to be entirely dried up.

div3.head: 17. Mon.
div3.p: Sent home the horse & buggy. Mary went to visit Dr & Mrs Brown. I had Asthma & bad head aches.

div3.head: 18. Tu.
div3.p: Reading. Robert went for Mary. Jos. & Magt. Wright & the Miss Wilsons dined here.

div3.head: Dec. 19. Wed.
div3.p: A gloomy day. The Eruption gives me little trouble. Mary & Robert returned. Reading. Recd a most affectionate farewell letter from my valued friend Dr Wm Brown.

div3.head: 20. Th.
div3.p: Sent by mail my check to E.M. Taylor, Cashr for $33.00 to get a Draft on New York at 5 per cent premium to pay for Books bought in Phila.

div3.head: 21. Fr.
div3.p: Mr Stover finished my work & I paid him for 11 3/4 days $11.75. I have been studying a little.

div3.head: 22. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Mrs James McClung & Mrs Mars T. Dossey came here & dined with us & a waggon came which the ladies sewing society had procured to be loaded chiefly with provisions which I value at $50.00

div3.head: 23. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel.

div3.head: 24. Mon.
div3.p: Went to Jos. Smith's & hired Jefferson for another year, at $110. Paid James Hall $4. Which in addition to $24 for the Cow for Rhoda makes $28. He deducted $2 for the time she was sick.

div3.head: 25. Tu.
div3.p: Christmas. Rode on horseback to John Brownlee's & preached at the Funl of his Son Samuel, aged 36. Who died in a moment in a waggon, going to Bethel, probably of Apoplexy.

div3.head: Decr. 25. Continued.
div3.p: Visited Alexr Brownlee who is now confined to bed.

div3.head: 26. Wed.
div3.p: At home; reading & writing. Letters from Genl Patterson Rev. Dr Ramsey, W.W. Trimble & Mr. Branch.

div3.head: 27. Th.
div3.p: Wrote to Genl Patterson. Preached at St. John's Ch. for Mr Crawford. Dined at James Bumgarners.

div3.head: 28. Fr.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 29. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. About 2 1/2 pm it began to snow moderately.

div3.head: 30. Sab.
div3.p: It snowed moderately through the night, but increased much in the morning & it fell fast all day. I did not go to Bethel-my sons went but found no one there.
I was seized with a severe pain in my back which crippled me very much.

div3.head: 31. Mon.
div3.p: It snowed nearly all night & This morning the snow is said to be 18 inches deep. Cleared off. Did not rise till 9 a.m. Back some better.

Thus closes the year 1860 in circumstances of great mercy to me & my family. We are all spared through another year & as far as I know, all in good health. And although my house be not so with God as I desire & pray for, yet hath he made with me and everlasting Covenant ordered in all things & sure; for this is all my Salvation & all my desire although he maketh it not to grow. 2 Sam. 23:5.

div3.head: January 1st 1861, Tuesday.
div3.p: Diary kept by Francis McFarland as an important aid to memory, especially in matters of business, & convenient for reference.

I am at home. I have been suffering with a pain in my back but it is much better. My family is all well & all at home but Betsey & Francis. Betsey is living in Williamsport Ten. & Francis in Washington City. Wrote to Betsey & to Robert Lyons.

div3.head: 2. Wed.
div3.p: Reading & writing letters.

div3.head: 3. Thurs.
div3.p: Wrote to Dr. Wm. Brown, Wm. S. Martin, & Co. & Mrs Alexr. Crawford. Pd. Montgomery's Bill for Smith work last year, $9.95.

div3.head: 4. Fr.
div3.p: This a day of Fasting, humiliation & prayer appointed by James Buchanan, President of the U. S. in view of the threatening aspect aspect of our public Affairs. I rejoiced at the appointment. We had a good Congn four Elders prayed appropriately. I prayed & made two addresses. I trust God will hear his people.

div3.head: 5. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 6. Sab.
div3.p: Stitch in my side & breast. Unwell. Preached as usual. A good Congn & good attention.

div3.head: 7. Mon
div3.p: Pain in my back aggravated. Reading.

div3.head: 8. Tu.
div3.p: My Birthday. I am 73 years old & have pretty good health. Glory be to the God of mercy. Attended a Prayer meeting at Samuel Hays'.

div3.head: Jan. 9. Wed.
div3.p: Rained fast till noon. Wrote to Wm. S. Martin & Co. & sent my Check for $16.00 for 8 subscribers to the "Presbyterian." Wrote also to Dr. Wm. Brown & remitted $52.00 by Check for 26 paying subscribers to the "Central Presbyterian." I receive two copies as agent, one of which I have sent to Dr. Wm. F. Humphreys.

div3.head: 10. Thurs.
div3.p: Mrs Gilkeson & Sally here. Reading.

div3.head: 11. Fr.
div3.p: Wrote to the Hon. Bolivar Christian, a member of the Legislature, in regard to the perilous state of the Country. This is the first letter I ever wrote, as far as I remember to exert political influence. But the Crisis demands the prayers & efforts of every good man.

div3.head: 12. Sat.
div3.p: Studying in preparation for the Sab.

div3.head: 13. Sab.
div3.p: Very cold & very rough roads. Preached at Bethel. Robert took Mary to Greenville.

div3.head: 14. Mon.
div3.p: Snow 2 inches deep. Thawing. Reading.

div3.head: 15. Tu.
div3.p: A very gloomy day. Working. Thompson McClure came to invite me to marry his sister Sarah & Mr Andw. A. Stuart on Thursday.

div3.head: 16. Wed.
div3.p: Day pleasant. Dined at Mrs M.M.A. Tate's Rebecca seems serious. Visited Phebe Patterson. Spent the night at Mr Wallace's.

div3.head: 17. Thurs.
div3.p: Rode to Mr McClure's & at 8 1/2 O'clock I married Mr Andrew A. Stuart & Miss Sarah S. McClure. Visited Mr McClung. Mr Alexr Brownlee & Mr Tarbet.

div3.head: Jan. 18. Fr.
div3.p: Gloomy & Rainy. Studying.

div3.head: 19. Sat.
div3.p: Studying.

div3.head: 20. Sab.
div3.p: Preached to a good & attentive Congn

div3.head: 21. Mon.
div3.p: Went to Staunton in my Buggy. The road terribly rough.

I received a splendid Gold watch, sent by Adam's Express, a present from Genl. Robert Patterson to his namesake, my son Robert P. I presume it cost $100. for he proposed to give him that sum in money if I preferred it. He is a noble generous friend.

I received the Minutes of Synod which were printed in Richmond by Wm. H. Clemmett, mailed for Richmond, Dec. 1st 1860. I took them to Col. Tate's to direct them for distribution by Mail: Col. & wife absent.

div3.head: 22. Tu.
div3.p: Wrought diligently till 11 a.m. then mailed 360 copies & paid postage $3.60. Left 20 copies with Davis A. Haysor for 4 churches named, being in the vicinity. Dined gratis at the Virginia Hotel, by invitation. Made various purchases, & came home. The delivery of the Watch produced quite a pleasant excitement in the family.
Reading the exciting news about the state of the country. Wrote to Genl. Patterson also to Wm. H. Clemmett & enclosed my Check for $46.00 the amount of his bill. At 6 P.M. it began to snow.

div3.head: Jany. 24. Th.
div3.p: Before day fine hail began to fall & continued till about 8 a.m. when it began to rain & it froze as it fell. The rain soon abated & it was a mist. About 4 inches of solid snow & hail on the ground.
Remitted my Check to Peter Walker for $8.00 to pay for the Biblical Repertory: $3. for Dr. Junkin for 1860 & $2.50 for 1861. & $2.50 for Rev. E.D. Junkin for 1861. Wrote to Dr. Junkin.

div3.head: 25. Fr.
div3.p: Studying & reading. Wrote to Rev Dr. J.R. Ramsey. Paid David Palmer for lumber in fall $9.73.

div3.head: 26. Sat.
div3.p: This has been a very Stormy day. About daybreak it began to snow very fast with a strong wind from NE. & continued without abatement till 2 p.m. when it gradually abated. Ther. at sunrise +26 but fell to +23 1/2 then rose to 26 & fell gradually to

div3.head: 27. Sab.
div3.p: About 6 inches of snow. Good sleighing. Went to Bethel on horseback, preached with some liberty to a good Congn

div3.head: 28. Mon.
div3.p: James & I went to Staunton in a sleigh-the first time I ever rode in a sleigh for many years. It proved not good sleighing. Robert went on horseback. The crowd was greater than I ever saw in Staunton. The object was to hear the Candidates for the Convention. Mr Stuart, Mr Sheffey, Genl. Harmon, Col. Baylor, Col. Baldwin & Capt. Imboden addressed a vast assembly. They all professed to be union men, but some more conservative.

div3.head: Jan. 28, continued.
div3.p: Called on Mrs Jordan. Bought an Overcoat for Robert at $12. Very cold riding home.

div3.head: 29. Tu.
div3.p: At home. Wrote to my son Francis. Reading.

div3.head: 30. Wed.
div3.p: Read Rev. Dr. N.L. Rice's Lectures on Slavery. They are able & opportune although I do not agree to every position. He also misstates remarks of mine in the Genl. Assy. of 1856. I find I am taken of a cold & retired early.

div3.head: 31. Th.
div3.p: In bed all day-bad head ache-bones aching.

div3.head: February 1. Fr.
div3.p: Spent a very restless night & am not much better than yesterday. In bed all day. Could not even read.

div3.head: 2. Sat.
div3.p: It rained much of last night & today & the snow is dissolving fast. I am somewhat better. Rose & dressed about 10 a.m. Not so well.

div3.head: 3. Sab.
div3.p: Spent a restless uncomfortable night. Pulse 104 this morning. Bones aching. Continued in bed all day. More unwell than yesterday. Mr Gilkeson called to see me.

div3.head: 4. Mon.
div3.p: Over 3 inches of snow fell last night. Spent an uncomfortable night. Sleep rather oppressed than refreshed me. In bed all day. At sunset rose & remained up till 9. Mrs McFarland taking cold just as I did Wednesday last. This an important day especially to Va. The election of members of the Convention took place today. I had intended to have taken an active part in the election for the fist time in my life, but God prevented me.

div3.head: Feb. 5. Tu.
div3.p: I slept better last night than since I was taken, but Mrs McFarland had a bad night with distressing headache. I rose early & remained up all day but she in bed all day with headache. I have a troublesome tickling cough.

div3.head: 6. Wed.
div3.p: Not so well today. Mrs McF. up, but not well.

div3.head: 7. Th.
div3.p: The highest wind I have known for years. I am better but not well. Mrs McFarland Do. Mr Pilson spent several hours with us.

div3.head: 8. Fr.
div3.p: We are better-Rested well. James W. Calhoun Called to see me.

div3.head: 9. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. A message came to inform me of the death of Nathaniel Tarbet. He was 80 years old & had been a member of Bethel Ch. since 1833. He was parallized.

div3.head: 10. Sab.
div3.p: Preached a Funeral Sermon to a good Congn The Coffin in front of the pulpit.

div3.head: 11. Mon.
div3.p: I am pretty well. Mrs McF. better. Wrote to Capt. James Henry & Governor Letcher Recd. a very kind & interesting letter from Hon. Bolivar Christian in regard to public affairs.

div3.head: 12. Tu.
div3.p: Working all day & I am very tired. Mrs McFarland is suffering with aching in her limbs.

div3.head: 13. Wed.
div3.p: Working & reading. Mrs McF. better. This is the day our Convention meets in Richmond. May Wisdom from above guide them.

div3.head: 14. Th.
div3.p: Working and Reading. Chilling atmosphere.

div3.head: 15. Fri.
div3.p: Studying. A heavy rain last night.

div3.head: 16. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. At 2 p.m. Rain. 3 p.m. Snow.

div3.head: Feb. 17. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a small Congn A little snow on the ground, the day cold & uncomfortable & the roads very bad.

div3.head: 18. Mon.
div3.p: Working & reading. Mr W.J. Gilkeson came & we settled all accounts to this date-I paid his bill of $19.26 & he paid me Salary $27.60. Robert brought me a D. of Sole Leather from W.F.

div3.head: 19. Tu.
div3.p: Reading & writing. Wrote to Rev. Jas. Morrison.

div3.head: 20. Wed.
div3.p: Day cold & blustery-weather such I dare not venture to go from home. Reading & working.

div3.head: 21. Th.
div3.p: Cold. Reading, & wrote to Phebe Patterson, as I cannot visit her in such weather & roads.

div3.head: 22. Fr.
div3.p: Reading & Studying. Day more pleasant.

div3.head: 23. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. The warmest day for 3 months.

div3.head: 24. Sab.
div3.p: Cold & wind high. Preached at Bethel to a good Congn for the day & the roads which are very bad. I suffered much today with cold feet, which disordered my bowels exceedingly. Had to go to bed at dark.

div3.head: 25. Mon.
div3.p: Reading. Wrote to Genl. Patterson & Mr See.

div3.head: 26. Tu.
div3.p: Working. Day very pleasant.

div3.head: 27. Wed.
div3.p: Not well today. Reading.

div3.head: 28. Thurs.
div3.p: Set off early to visit the sick. Called at Mrs Tate's for half an hour. Spent an hour & a half with Phebe Patterson. She is feeble, but more comfortable than he has been. Mind calm but anxious to not be deceived. Spent 2 hours at Mr McClung's & dined. Visited Alexr. Brownlee-he is suffering more pain & confined entirely to bed. Called to see Saml. Hayes who is much afflicted, but in good health.

div3.head: March 1st Friday.
div3.p: Unwell; could not study.

div3.head: 2. Sat.
div3.p: Better. Studying.

div3.head: 3. Sab.
div3.p: Very warm. Preached at Bethel to a good & an attentive Congregation.

div3.head: 4. Mon.
div3.p: Mrs McF. and I set out early to see Maria Blackwood who yesterday fell 3 times apparently from pressing of blood on the brain. She was unconscious each time. Is pretty well today. We went to Mr Pilson's-Samuel has been very unwell with Erysipelas-is not better. Went to see Arlidore Bare who has been very ill with Pneumonia. Prayed with him. Called also to see Bob Scott who has been very near death with Pneumonia & Delirium tremens & is still very low. Offered a short prayer with him. Came home.

div3.head: 5. Tu.
div3.p: Rode to Mr Joseph Smith's to pay him for the hire of his servant Jef. for the last year. I paid him $110.00 Day very cold.

div3.head: 6. Wed.
div3.p: Day Cold. Reading &c. Recd. President Lincoln's Inaugural Address which I read with deep interest. It leaves me in great doubt whether his policy will preserve the peace of the Country.

div3.head: 7. Thurs.
div3.p: Chilling E. wind. Studying.

div3.head: 8. Fr.
div3.p: Went to Greenville. Dined at Wm. F. Smith's. Visited Wm. Thompson & called at Mr Blackwood's & at the Post Office, thence home.

div3.head: 9. Sat.
div3.p: It rained much last night & very heavily this morning-then cleared cooler. Studying.

div3.head: March 10. Sab.
div3.p: Preached at Bethel to a moderate sized Congn I laboured to prove that all should come to the Lord's Supper, but with the wedding garment of a Saviour's Righteousness. There was excellent attention.
Attended a prayer meeting at John Hay's.

div3.head: 11. Mon.
div3.p: Last night I felt much fatigued & found I had taken some cold. Today I feel very little energy and have been reading only. A little snow last night.

div3.head: 12. Tu.
div3.p: Preparing for Catechising. Pleasant day.

div3.head: 13. Wed.
div3.p: Pleasant day. Mrs McF. & I dined at Mr Trotter's, he not at home. Called at John Hays'. Home.

div3.head: 14. Thurs.
div3.p: A great change in the weather. It began early to rain moderately with the wind NE. but soon turned to snow, & in the afternoon snowed much.

div3.head: 15. Fr.
div3.p: Unwell with a cold, & there is some eruption on my left leg. Remitted a gold dollar to pay for the Journal of Commerce for another yr.

div3.head: 16. Sat.
div3.p: Still unwell & poorly prepared for study. Robert & James & Mary went to Staunton.

div3.head: 17. Sab.
div3.p: Unwell. For three mornings I have not risen till after breakfast. I preached however with more liberty than usual a very attentive Congn The day cool & damp.

div3.head: 18. Mon.
div3.p: I am better. The day very cold. Began to snow early & continued unabated all day. Reading. Rebecca Wilson & James Wilson's daughter here.

div3.head: 19. Tu.
div3.p: Cold. Reading & preparing for Catechising.

div3.head: March 20. Wed.
div3.p: Unwell. Rode on horseback to Mrs Patterson's Phebe about when I last saw her. Dined there. Hold a Catechising at Broadhead & returned home.

div3.head: 21. Thurs.
div3.p: I suffered extremely last night with itching & burning in my skin although very little eruption has yet appeared. This day very cold. Reading Newspapers.

div3.head: 22. Fr.
div3.p: Still unwell & suffering from cutaneous irritation principally on my back now. Attended a Catechising at Mount Ida.

div3.head: 23. Sat.
div3.p: Studying. Uncomfortable last night. Better today. Lent Wm. J. Gilkeson $64.00.

div3.head: 24. Sab.
div3.p: I spent a very uncomfortable feverish night a stitch in my right breast. Ate my breakfast in bed. But went to Bethel & preached as usual to a good congregation. Rev. Mr Wasson, Methodist, made the first prayer.

div3.head: 25. Mon.
div3.p: The irritation of my skin is such & I am so threatened with increased eruption that I thought it necessary to go today to Crawford's Sulphur Spring. Set out on horseback. Called at Mr Bumgarner's-dined at Wm. Dunlap's-called at David Kunkle's-was very kindly received by Mr Crawford & family.

div3.head: 26. Tu.
div3.p: Rested better than usual. Recorded some Minutes.

div3.head: 27. Wed.
div3.p: A heavy rain last night with thunder & lightening. Mr. F.H. Hill, son in law to Dr. McCherney came here on a fishing excursion & is in the room with me. He lives at Madison C.H. & is Clerk of both courts. Took Miss Harriet C. in a buggy to the Variety Springs. Mr & Mrs Brerrus kindly invited me to visit them.

div3.head: 28 March. Thurs.
div3.p: The Sulphur water acts amazingly as a diuretic. Visited Old Mr Jacob Kunkle & wife took tea at David Kunkle's James Bumgarner there.

div3.head: 29. Fr.
div3.p: I feel entirely relieved! Set off for home. Stopped at Mr Robert Dunlap's & had an interesting religious conversation with his wife. Dined at Archd Sproul's & had an interesting religious conversation with him.

div3.head: 30. Sat.
div3.p: Mr Joshua Munroe came for me to preach at the Funeral of John Hays, a member of Bethel Ch. received by me 36 years ago. He died on yesterday, aged 77. I preached to quite a large assembly.

div3.head: 31. Sab.
div3.p: I am well now. Preached today to a good Congn & although from want of time my preparation was imperfect, I was helped to preach to an attentive Congn

div3.head: April 1. Mon.
div3.p: Too unpleasant to visit. Wrote to Genl. Patterson, Wm. L. Bond, & my son Francis. It rained a little.

div3.head: 2. Tu.
div3.p: Visited Alexr. Brownlee, who is suffering more than usual. Visited also Phebe Patterson, she is very low. Spent the night at Mr Wallace's. Mrs W. very unwell.

div3.head: 3. Wed.
div3.p: Visited at John Brownlee's & dined at Adam Hawpe's. Visited Mr & Mrs Trice & Mr & Mrs Trevey. Finished sowing oats.

div3.head: 4. Thurs.
div3.p: Damp & uncomfortable. I am taking cold. Went to see James Swink-he seems very serious, but not yet prepared to make a profession of Religion. Called at James Hays' & dined at Saml. Hays'.

div3.head: April 5. Friday.
div3.p: This day the series commenced preparatory to the Lord's Supper. Mr See preached-he & his wife came home with us.

div3.head: 6. Sat.
div3.p: It began to rain early & continued to rain moderately most of the day. Mr See preached today on Sanctification. Congn Small. We received in the Communion of the Ch. on Exmn. Rebecca C. Tate & Ann, servt of Wm. J. Gilkeson; & on Cert. James A. Tomhuton.

div3.head: 7. Sab.
div3.p: Snowed fast till later in the middle of the day, but melted fast. Went to Bethel. The session recd. John Strain & Rebecca Strain on Cert. from New Providence. Mr See preached a good Sermon to a Small Congn from John 13:1 last clause.

div3.head: 8. Mon.
div3.p: Day very damp & unpleasant with a drizzle sometimes approaching a rain. I was recording Minutes of Synod.

div3.head: 9. Tu.
div3.p: It began to rain early last night & rained heavily all night & today it rained the whole day incessantly with scarcely any abatement at any time. I have seldom, if ever, seen such a day's rain. The meadow N. of the house was almost entirely covered by the flood all the afternoon. I have never seen a flood there before.
I was recording Minutes of Synod.

div3.head: 10. Wed.
div3.p:
It continued to rain last night till about 10 O'clock when it began to snow and
continued to snow today till about noon. The ground being so wet it melted fast, still there was in places 3 or 4 inches of snow. A little before sunset it began to clear off.
Recording Minutes of Synod. I cannot with comfort record more than 5 pages a day.

div3.head: April 11. Thurs.
div3.p: I have been preparing for the Sabbath.
Went to Mint Spring & to Greenville. Dined at Mrs Grahams with the Rev. Mr Lambeth & wife. Paid Mr Lightner's bill. Got my horse shod & came home in a heavy rain.

div3.head: 13. Sat.
div3.p: Last night there was again a tremendously heavy rain & a great flood this morning, but not so great as on Tuesday. The indications of fair weather more encouraging today. Mary & Robert went to Mrs Patterson's-Phebe very low. James went to muster. I am studying. Sent to Mr Lightner $10. to buy Tea &c.

div3.head: 14. Sab.
div3.p: Went to Bethel & preached. Unwell with cold. Ground saturated with water.

div3.head: 15. Mon.
div3.p: Preparing to go to Presbytery. In the afternoon went to Mrs Sprouls & spent the night. Very damp & Cool.

div3.head: 16. Tu.
div3.p: A good deal asthmatic last night. The morning unpleasant. About 9 a.m. set out, but it soon began to rain heavily & was compelled to stop at Rev. E.D. Junkin's where I remained all night & was very kindly treated.

div3.head: 17. Wed.
div3.p: Slept comfortably. Snowing, but did not entirely cover the ground. Set off at 7 1/4 for Lexington & arrived at 11 1/2. Drove to Col. Reid's-attended Presbytery. Took tea at Dr. White's. Mr E.D. Junkin was on my motion elected modr. Heard Mr Irwin preach a good Sermon.

div3.head: April 18. Thurs.
div3.p: Did not rest very well.

Recd. a letter from my son Robert stating that James was ordered to march immediately with his Company I know not where. O God watch over my dear Son. I feel intense anxiety & distress at the state of our public affairs. Capt. Letcher's Company of Rifles marched from Lexington at 2 P.M. Mr Tebby a Methodist minister & I were called upon to offer prayer for them just before their departure. Mr Pilson who was present said there were not so many tears shed under any prayer I ever offered.

Capt. White's Company of Cavalry marched at 6 p.m. I dined at Dr. Junkin's. He called together what Trustees could be found (8 I think) & tendered his Resignation which was unanimously accepted. I was appointed a Commissioner to the Genl. Assembly. I told the Pby. I would accept the appointment on the condition that I should be allowed to exercise my own judgment, whether in the present troubled state of the country, I should go or not. Took tea at Prof. Campbell's. Heard N.W. Calhoun preach.

div3.head: 19. Fri.
div3.p: The Pres. Ordained Thos. L. Preston as an Evangelist. I was appointed to preside & deliver the Charge, which I did.

I received of the Treasr. $40. in advance, as expenses to & from the Genl. Assy. Also of M. Pilson for Minutes of the Assy. $1.00. Feeling so anxious about my dear James & their trouble at home, I obtained leave of absence & came 15 miles to Mr Nelson Bell's.

div3.head: April 20th. Sat.
div3.p: Did not rest well. Set off early-stopped at B. Smith's a short time. Heard near Greenville of the death of Phebe Patterson & recd. a Note from Mary in Greenville. Reached home before noon.
